Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis lid; interior: glazed black with two bands in added red; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of sphinx or siren (head, neck, chest, part of wings, torso remaining), to left with wings outspread; faded added white on face and chest, line on wings above small feathers; incised splinter rosette (mostly fired red) as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: A touch of dilute brown on the right of the sherd might be a sphinx's tail curling back in the manner of Lydos b.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 341, no. B413)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0789) (Phase 1)
